segments.text: I notice the water overflowing, spilling onto the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying a plate like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is in the water, but she doesn’t even seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being so clever, sneaking cookies right under her nose.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks like it’s about to fall, and the boy is stretching so far.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel a little sad that she’s missing all of this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, like nothing could ever go wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll ever turn around and see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is just waiting for something to go wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR
